plot: John Oliver takes a look at why people of color are routinely excluded from becoming jurors, who their absence impacts, and what we can do to create a fairer system.

John Oliver talks about racial discrimination in selecting a jury of a trial. He explains why it is a valid concern for the justice system and how this discrimination is affecting the final verdict of various cases. Finally he suggested the ways to reform the current jury selection practice.—Niaz Islam Arif
